uk.ac.ebi.miriam.lib
Class MiriamLink

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.miriam.lib.MiriamLink
public class MiriamLink
extends Object

Library for using MIRIAM Web Services easily (via a Java program).

MIRIAM is an online resource created to catalog biological data types, their URIs and the corresponding physical URLs, whether these are controlled vocabularies or databases.

See MIRIAM Resources, for more information.

getDataTypeURN

public String getDataTypeURN(String name)
Retrieves the unique URN of a data type (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - primary name (or synonym) of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt", "GO")
Returns:
unique (official) URN of the data type

getDataTypeURNs

public String[] getDataTypeURNs(String name)
Retrieves the unique (official) URN of the data type (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org") and all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name or synonym of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URN and all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeURL

public String getDataTypeURL(String name)
Retrieves unique (official) URL (not a physical URL but a URI) of the data type (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/").

Parameters:
name - name of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URL of the data type

getDataTypeURLs

public String[] getDataTypeURLs(String name)
Retrieves the unique (official) URL (not a physical URL but a URI) of the data type (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/") and all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URL of the data type and all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeURI

public String getDataTypeURI(String name,
                             String type)
Retrieves the unique (official) URL or URN of the data type (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name of the data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL'), can be empty
Returns:
unique URL or URN of the data type

getDataTypeURIs

public String[] getDataTypeURIs(String name,
                                String type)
Retrieves all the URLs or URNs of the data type (examples: "http://www.taxonomy.org/", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org") including all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name of the data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL'), can be empty
Returns:
all the URIs (URLs or URNs) of the data type including all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeAllURIs

public String[] getDataTypeAllURIs(String name)
Retrieves all the URLs and URNs of the data type (examples: "http://www.taxonomy.org/", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org") including all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name of the data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
all the URIs (URLs and URNs) of the data type including all the deprecated ones

getResourceLocation

public String getResourceLocation(String id)
Retrieves the location (or country) of a resource (example: "United Kingdom").

Parameters:
id - identifier of a resource (example: "MIR:00100009")
Returns:
the location (the country) where the resource is managed

getResourceInstitution

public String getResourceInstitution(String id)
Retrieves the institution of a resource (example: "European Bioinformatics Institute").

Parameters:
id - identifier of a resource (example: "MIR:00100009")
Returns:
the institution managing the resource

getResourceInfo

public String getResourceInfo(String id)
Retrieves the information about a resource.

Parameters:
id - identifier of a resource (example: "MIR:00100009")
Returns:
some information about the resource

getURN

public String getURN(String name,
                     String id)
Retrieves the unique URN of the data-entry (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org:P62158").

Parameters:
name - name of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
unique URN of the data-entry

getURL

public String getURL(String name,
                     String id)
Retrieves unique URN of the data-entry (example: "http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202").

Parameters:
name - name of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
unique URN of the data-entry

getURI

public String getURI(String name,
                     String id,
                     String type)
Retrieves the unique URI (URL or URN) of the data-entry (example: "http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL')
Returns:
unique URI of the data-entry

getDataTypeDef

public String getDataTypeDef(String nickname)
Retrieves the definition of the data type.

Parameters:
nickname - name or URI (URN or URL) of a data type
Returns:
definition of the data type

getDataEntries

public String[] getDataEntries(String nickname,
                               String id)
Retrieves the physical locationS (URLs) of web pageS about the data-entry.

Parameters:
nickname - name (can be a synonym) or URN or URL of a data type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
physical locationS of web pageS about the data-entry

getDataEntries

public String[] getDataEntries(String uri)
Retrieves the physical locationS (URLs) of web pageS about the data-entry.

Parameters:
uri - Miriam URI of an element (example: 'http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202')
Returns:
physical locationS of web pageS about the data-entry

getDataEntry

public String getDataEntry(String uri,
                           String resource)
Retrieves the physical location (URL) of a web page about the data-entry, using a specific resource.

Parameters:
uri - Miriam URI of an element (example: 'http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202')
resource - internal identifier of a resource (example: 'MIR:00100005')
Returns:
physical location of a web page about the data-entry, using a specific resource

getDataResources

public String[] getDataResources(String nickname)
Retrieves all the physical locations (URLs) of the services providing the data type (web page).

Parameters:
nickname - name (can be a synonym) or URL or URN of a data type name (or synonym) or URI (URL or URN)
Returns:
array of strings containing all the physical locations

isDeprecated

public boolean isDeprecated(String uri)
To know if a URI of a data type is deprecated.

Parameters:
uri - (URN or URL) of a data type
Returns:
answer ("true" or "false") to the question: is this URI deprecated?

getOfficialURI

public String getOfficialURI(String uri)
Retrieves the offical URI (URN if the user entered a URN, URL if not) corresponding to the deprecated one.

Parameters:
uri - deprecated URI (URN or URL) of a data type
Returns:
the offical URI corresponding to the deprecated one

getDataTypePattern

public String getDataTypePattern(String nickname)
Retrieves the pattern (regular expression) of the data type.

Parameters:
nickname - data type name (or synonym) or URI (URL or URN) of a data type
Returns:
pattern of the data type

getDataTypeSynonyms

public String[] getDataTypeSynonyms(String name)
Retrieves all the synonym names of the data type, with the original name.

Parameters:
name - name or synonym of a data type
Returns:
all the synonym names of the data type

getName

public String getName(String uri)
Retrieves the common name of a data type.

Parameters:
uri - URI (URL or URN) of a data type
Returns:
the common name of the data type

getNames

public String[] getNames(String uri)
Retrieves all the names (with synonyms) of a data type.

Parameters:
uri - URI (URL or URN) of a data type
Returns:
the common name of the data type and all the synonyms

getDataTypesName

public String[] getDataTypesName()
Retrieves the list of names of all the data types available.

Returns:
list of names of all the data types

getDataTypesId

public String[] getDataTypesId()
Retrieves the list of identifiers (stable and perenial) of all the data types.

Returns:
list of identifiers of all the data types

checkRegExp

public boolean checkRegExp(String identifier,
                           String datatype)
Checks if the identifier given follows the regular expression of the data type (also provided).

Parameters:
identifier - internal identifier used by the data type
datatype - name, synonym or MIRIAM URI of a data type
Returns:
"true" if the identifier follows the regular expression, "false" otherwise
